    function loadCSS(href, before, media) {
      var ss = window.document.createElement("link");
      var ref = before || window.document.getElementsByTagName("meta")[0];
      var sheets = window.document.styleSheets;
      ss.rel = "stylesheet";
      ss.href = href.trim();
      ss.media = "only x";
      ref.parentNode.appendChild(ss, ref);
      function toggleMedia() {
        var defined;
        for (var i = 0; i < sheets.length; i++) {
          if (sheets[i].href && sheets[i].href.indexOf(href.trim().substr(-8)) > -1) {
            defined = true;
          }
        }
        if (defined) {
          ss.media = media || "all";
        }
        else {
          setTimeout(toggleMedia);
        }
      }

      toggleMedia();
      return ss;
    }

    window.loadCSS = loadCSS;
    </script><script>
    function loadJs(src) {
      var ref = window.document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0];
      var script = window.document.createElement("script");
      script.src = src;
      script.defer = 1;
      ref.parentNode.insertBefore(script, ref);
      return script;
    }
    window.loadJs = loadJs
    </script><script>
    function whenAvailable(name, callback, ms) {
      const interval = ms ? ms : 15; // ms
      var timeout = window.setTimeout(function () {
        if (window[name]) {
          window.clearTimeout(timeout);
          callback(window[name]);
        } else {
          window.setTimeout(arguments.callee, interval);
        }
      }, interval);
    }
    window.whenAvailable = whenAvailable;

      const encryptedDocumentKey = 'q9dRKdA6P3zEuupGxSAPNGigO7s0inS7fxbyjIEmjJbznYXd28cGMPk0xz5k2SYxiJaprKxF+4DIFPG9IHl39YEfvb1Z5cb8mWnPUT897137s8sMnLKcLsfXd0PtKU5bu83KRT+R4SLv8L4MLuRkOu0EWHfdgGXT5lSOla71R5BNU8VFxtuQPZKZSINJe/roo2gr4H8+AMTakHZ6pFX5x2xlsJu8lrkcIehPKm2qqBF5dkkGWjXFiSWjlU8GLQ==';
      window.entitlementsAsyncData = getCurrentUser(entitlementsUrl, encryptedDocumentKey, { cache: false });

      window.entitlementsAsyncData
        .then((retrievedUser = {}) => {
          performance.mark('ads-receive-entitlements');

          if (retrievedUser.redirect) {
            window.location.href = retrievedUser.redirect;
            return;
          }

          const {
            companyDetails: { company_codes: companyCodes, name: companyName = '' } = {},
            documentKey,
            execEdition,
            experience,
            facebookSub,
            tags,
            type,
            vxid,
            paywall,
            permissions: { wsjPausedSub } = {},
            emailHashes,
            profiles,
          } = retrievedUser || {};

          // Set emailHashes property in DL and call Liveramp via GMS
          if(emailHashes){
            window.__ace('dataLayer', 'setData',[{emailHashes}]);
            window.__ace('liveramp','setEmailHashes',[emailHashes]);
          }

          window.utag_data.cx_shield = paywall;

          if(!isSnippetView) {
            const userTargeting = {
              circ: type,
              // AdTech renamed circ to usertype in data layer
              usertype: type
            };

            window.utag_data.profiles = profiles || '';
            window.utag_data.user_exp = experience || '';
            window.utag_data.user_ref = (vxid && `V2-${vxid}`) || '';
            window.utag_data.user_tags = (tags && tags.join) ? tags.join(',') : '';
            window.utag_data.user_type = type || '';
            window.utag_data.article_template = !documentKey ? 'preview' : 'full';

            if (wsjPausedSub) {
              window.utag_data.sub_paused = 'true';
            }

            if (facebookSub) {
              window.utag_data.fbSub = 'true';
            }

            if (execEdition) {
              const companyId = (companyCodes && companyCodes.join('|')) || '';

              window.utag_data.company_id = companyId;
              window.utag_data.company_name = companyName;
              window.utag_data.page_site = 'WSJ Executive';
              window.utag_data.page_site_product = 'WSJEXEC';
              window.utag_data.page_content_region = 'Global';
            }

            try {
              window.__ace('dataLayer', 'setData',[{...targeting, ...userTargeting}]);
            } catch(e) {}
          }
        })
        .catch((error) => console.error(error));
    }

    // First, get the entitlements
    requestEntitlements();
  })();

  (function() {

      djab_eventQueue = [];

      function handleOptimizelyMetric(metric){
        if (typeof metric === 'object'){
          if (window.optimizelyEdge){
            window.optimizelyEdge.push(metric);
          } else {
            djab_eventQueue.push(metric);
          }
        }
      }

      function handleQueuedOptimizelyMetrics(){
        let len = djab_eventQueue.length;
        while (len--) {
            if (typeof djab_eventQueue[len] === 'object'){
              window.optimizelyEdge.push(djab_eventQueue[len]);
            }
        }
      }

      window.djab_handleOptimizelyMetric = handleOptimizelyMetric;
      window.djab_handleQueuedOptimizelyMetrics = handleQueuedOptimizelyMetrics;
      performance.mark('djab-available-metricHandler');

  })();

What she didn’t predict was just how quickly this would happen. “I didn’t imagine people would be like, ‘Let’s replace lawyers with a chatbot,’ or ‘Let’s sell AI generated art that looks exactly like Artificial Intelligence Research Institute (DAIR), a nonprofit she launched in 2021 with backing from the MacArthur Foundation, the Rockefeller Foundation, the Ford Foundation and others. Much of her work involves highlighting the ways AI programs can reinforce existing prejudices. “We talk about algorithms, but we don’t talk about who’s constructing the data set or who’s in the data set,” she says. Because machine-learning systems adopt patterns of language and images scraped from the internet, they are often riddled with the internet’s all-too-human flaws: “If the input data is biased, then the What she didn’t predict was just how quickly this would happen. “I didn’t imagine people would be like, ‘Let’s replace lawyers with a chatbot,’ or ‘Let’s sell AI generated art that looks exactly like someone else’s,’” she says over video from her home in California’s Bay Area. “I didn’t anticipate using chatbots in search engines, which is a bonkers idea that everyone is now racing to do.”","properties":{}}],"properties":{}},{"type":"inset","id":"inset-2","inset_type":"pullquote","properties":{"responsive":{"layout":"wrap"},"scope":{"scope":["web","mobileapps"]}},"ref":"inset-2","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"‘If the input data is biased, then the output can amplify such biases.’","properties":{}}],"properties":{}},{"type":"tagline","properties":{}}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Dr. Gebru, 39, is the founder and executive director of the Distributed Artificial Intelligence Research Institute (DAIR), a nonprofit she launched in 2021 with backing from the MacArthur Foundation, the Rockefeller Foundation, the Ford Foundation and others. Much of her work involves highlighting the ways AI programs can reinforce existing prejudices. “We talk about algorithms, but we don’t talk about who’s constructing the data set or who’s in the data set,” she says. Because machine-learning systems adopt patterns of language and images scraped from the internet, they are often riddled with the internet’s all-too-human flaws: “If the input data is biased, then the output can amplify such biases.”","properties":{}}],"properties":{}}],"byline":[{"text":"By "},{"type":"phrase","phrase_type":"author","id":"9386","ref":"author|Emily Bobrow","text":"Emily Bobrow","seoname":"emily-bobrow","emailaddress":"emily.bobrow@wsj.com","facebookaccount":"","twitterhandle":"EmilyBobrow","hedcutimage":"https://images.wsj.net/im-634700/AM","biography":"\u003cp\u003eEmily Bobrow is a staff reporter for The Wall Street Journal’s Review section, where she writes the weekly profile column Weekend Confidential. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003ePreviously, she worked as a staff editor and writer at The Economist, covering culture, politics and policy in New York, London and Washington, D.C. Much of her work involves highlighting the ways AI programs can reinforce existing prejudices. “We talk about algorithms, but we don’t talk about who’s constructing the data set or who’s in the data set,” she says. Because machine-learning systems adopt patterns of language and images scraped from the internet, they are often riddled with the internet’s all-too-human flaws: “If the input data is biased, then the readabilityObject.title: Timnit Gebru Is Calling Attention to the Pitfalls of AI
readabilityObject.content:
Feb. 24, 2023 12:27 pm ET

As a leading researcher on the ethics of artificial intelligence, Timnit Gebru has long believed that machine-learning algorithms could one day power much of our lives. What she didn’t predict was just how quickly this would happen. “I didn’t imagine people would be like, ‘Let’s replace lawyers with a chatbot,’ or ‘Let’s sell AI generated art that looks exactly like someone else’s,’” she says over video from her home in California’s Bay Area. “I didn’t anticipate using chatbots in search engines, which is a bonkers idea that everyone is now racing to do.”

Dr. Gebru, 39, is the founder and executive director of the Distributed Artificial Intelligence Research Institute (DAIR), a nonprofit she launched in 2021 with backing from the MacArthur Foundation, the Rockefeller Foundation, the Ford Foundation and others. Much of her work involves highlighting the ways AI programs can reinforce existing prejudices. “We talk about algorithms, but we don’t talk about who’s constructing the data set or who’s in the data set,” she says. Because machine-learning systems adopt patterns of language and images scraped from the internet, they are often riddled with the internet’s all-too-human flaws: “If the input data is biased, then the output can amplify such biases.”
